content:
• Monday, December 5, 2011
  • EXAS

    Exact Sciences (NASDAQ:EXAS) announces a secondary offering for a yet undisclosed amount of...

    Exact Sciences (NASDAQ:EXAS) announces a secondary offering for a yet undisclosed amount of shares. Robert W. Baird is acting as sole book-running manager in the offering. Shares -6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:34 PM
  • NATH

    Shares of Nathan's Famous (NASDAQ:NATH) are up post-trading after the company announces a...

    Shares of Nathan's Famous (NASDAQ:NATH) are up post-trading after the company announces a modified Dutch Auction tender offer to purchase up to 500K shares of its common stock at a price per share of not less than $20.00 or greater than $22.00. Shares +9.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR) drops 6.2% AH after announcing plans to issue $300M in Class A shares, to help...

    Clearwire (CLWR) drops 6.2% AH after announcing plans to issue $300M in Class A shares, to help finance its 4G network build. The carrier adds Sprint (NYSE:S) is exercising its preemptive rights related to the offering, which it will use by purchasing Class B shares. Clearwire shares took off last week on news of a new funding agreement with Sprint.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • KMX

    CarMax (KMX +5.9%) shares jumped as Robert W. Baird defended the used-car dealership chain...

    CarMax (KMX +5.9%) shares jumped as Robert W. Baird defended the used-car dealership chain against concerns over lost share. Baird's Craig Kennison explained that CarMax takes all types of trade-ins from customers, not just higher-quality cars, and sells the lower-quality vehicles wholesale. When taking the wholesale business into account, the company is "actually gaining share."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • HSBC

    Shares of HSBC Holdings (HBC +2%) close higher after the company spins off HSBC Capital...

    Shares of HSBC Holdings (HBC +2%) close higher after the company spins off HSBC Capital Management, its U.S. buyout arm, into a new firm called Graycliff Partners. Graycliff Partners has around $1M assets under management which it invests in middle-sized companies providing equity and mezzanine financing.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • MS

    Financial stocks (XLF +1.7%) have withstood the S&P downgrade reports and a Wells Fargo...

    Financial stocks (XLF +1.7%) have withstood the S&P downgrade reports and a Wells Fargo report slashing Q4 industry EPS estimates in good shape and are still today’s best performing sector. Morgan Stanley (MS +6.8%), often a poster child for eurozone exposure worries, seems to be building strength through the day; C +5.7%, JPM +3.6%, BAC +2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • HIG

    Hartford Financial Services (HIG +3%) trades higher into the close after announcing it's sold...

    Hartford Financial Services (HIG +3%) trades higher into the close after announcing it's sold all the assets of its Florham Park, NJ subsidiary, Hartford Life Private Placement, to Philadelphia Financial Group, a private placement insurance market, for $117.5M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • DWA

    Dreamworks (DWA -1.7%) suffers its second stock downgrade in a week, as Piper Jaffray lowers...

    Dreamworks (DWA -1.7%) suffers its second stock downgrade in a week, as Piper Jaffray lowers shares to Neutral and slashes its target price to $20 from $33, citing concerns about competition: "Recent performance of [its] films... suggests saturation in the family genre. While share of box for family genre has increased, per film performance has slipped." (prior)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • DNKN

    Dunkin Brands (DNKN +2.2%) gains on an upgrade to Outperform on valuation at Raymond James,...

    Dunkin Brands (DNKN +2.2%) gains on an upgrade to Outperform on valuation at Raymond James, citing the company's recent franchise expansion efforts.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • KOP

    Koppers Holdings (KOP +1.7%) trades higher today after announcing it's closed its undeperforming...

    Koppers Holdings (KOP +1.7%) trades higher today after announcing it's closed its undeperforming manufacturing operations at its carbon black manufacturing facility in Kurnell, New South Wales, Australia.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU -1.3%) underperforms following additional negative commentary from Citron...

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU -1.3%) underperforms following additional negative commentary from Citron Research, which set a $5 PT for Qihoo shares several weeks ago. Citron questions the legitimacy of Qihoo's Q3 revenue figure, arguing its browser homepage ad sales are overstated. It also claims Mirae Asset's bullish coverage of Qihoo amounts to "professional malpractice."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • THC

    A program to pre-approve Medicare hospital payments for pacemakers and joint replacements...

    A program to pre-approve Medicare hospital payments for pacemakers and joint replacements apparently is limited to Florida, contrary to an earlier report that Medicare wouldn’t pay for a range of procedures in 11 states. An expanded version of Florida’s program is unlikely to take effect in an election year, Credit Suisse says (earlier). Bouncing back: THC +11%, HCA +5.9%, CYH +2.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • BHC

    Medicis Pharmaceutical (MRX +2.3%) gains after saying it's completed its acquisition of bankrupt...

    Medicis Pharmaceutical (MRX +2.3%) gains after saying it's completed its acquisition of bankrupt Canadian drug maker Graceway Pharmaceuticals. Through the purchase Medicis gains access to Graceway's strong R&D pipeline, including several patented and patent-pending mid-to-late stage assets, with an annual net sales peak potential of over $500M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • GE

    GE (GE +1.5%) signs a $300M contract with Saudi Electricity to expand six power plants across...

    GE (GE +1.5%) signs a $300M contract with Saudi Electricity to expand six power plants across Saudi Arabia in order to meet increased power demand and avoid blackouts. The expansions, which include 13 gas turbines, are expected to add nearly 800 megawatts of power to the Saudi grid by the summer of 2013, and bring the number of GE turbines delivered for Saudi Electricity projects to nearly 200 over the past five years.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • CPST

    Capstone Turbine (CPST +7.7%) gains after announcing it's extended its original equipment...

    Capstone Turbine (CPST +7.7%) gains after announcing it's extended its original equipment manufacturer contract with GE (GE +1.5%) to build its clean-cycle generators through January 2016.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • STMP

    The USPS, which has been hemorrhaging cash and weighing restructuring options, plans to slow the...

    The USPS, which has been hemorrhaging cash and weighing restructuring options, plans to slow the delivery of first-class mail for the first time in 40 years. Whereas 42% of first-class mail currently arrives in one day, all deliveries will take two days or longer after budget cuts go through. Stamps.com (STMP -3.1%) is selling off on the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 5 Comments
  • TVIAQ

    Solazyme (SZYM +7.2%) trades up after announcing it's partnered with Dynamic Fuels, a joint...

    Solazyme (SZYM +7.2%) trades up after announcing it's partnered with Dynamic Fuels, a joint venture between Tyson Foods (TSN +0.7%) and Syntroleum (SYNM +6.7%), to supply the U.S. Navy with 450K gallons of renewable marine and jet fuels.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG +5.2%) trades higher after BMO Capital ups it to Outperform on valuation, citing...

    Transocean (RIG +5.2%) trades higher after BMO Capital ups it to Outperform on valuation, citing the company's strong offshore drilling fundamentals.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHTR

    Time Warner Cable (TWC -2.1%) shares turn lower after CFO Irene Esteves says the cable TV...

    Time Warner Cable (TWC -2.1%) shares turn lower after CFO Irene Esteves says the cable TV provider doesn’t "feel a need to get larger." Earlier, TWC and Comcast (CMCSA -0.8%) were upgraded by Stifel Nicolaus, believing that Verizon's Spectrum deal will allow the two firms to fill gaps in their product line by reselling Verizon services, and will take them out of competition with wireless.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • GCI

    Gannett (GCI +11.6%) soars after Lazard upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral, and Citigroup calls...

    Gannett (GCI +11.6%) soars after Lazard upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral, and Citigroup calls attention to an improving outlook from the National Association of Newspapers on the sector that includes a forecast of a 4.8% drop in advertising revenue for Q4 - compared to a 9% decline in Q3. Other newspapers stocks are rallying as well: NYT +3.6%, MNI +4.8%, SSP +2.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • OMX

    OfficeMax (OMX +6.7%) moves up after Moody's put its stamp of approval on its new strategic plan...

    OfficeMax (OMX +6.7%) moves up after Moody's put its stamp of approval on its new strategic plan late Friday, removing the prospects of a downgrade anytime soon.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • USAT

    USA Technologies (USAT +5.6%) bounces higher after saying it's appointed Stephen Herbert as CEO...

    USA Technologies (USAT +5.6%) bounces higher after saying it's appointed Stephen Herbert as CEO and chairman of the board, effective immediately. Herbert has served as the company's COO since 1999 and as interim CEO and chairman since October 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • SAP

    Though many are extolling the benefits (I, II, III) of SAP's (SAP -0.5%) purchase of...

    Though many are extolling the benefits (I, II, III) of SAP's (SAP -0.5%) purchase of SuccessFactors (SFSF +51.2%), concerns about the deal's price are weighing on shares. Meanwhile, Chris Kanaracus sees challenges in integrating SuccessFactors' software with SAP's numerous products, and Jeffrey M. Kaplan is worried about a culture clash. Cowen views SAP's buy as a defensive move aimed at slowing down Workday's advance.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • CIE

    Cobalt International Energy (CIE +2.5%) trades higher after Deutsche intiates the shares with a...

    Cobalt International Energy (CIE +2.5%) trades higher after Deutsche intiates the shares with a Buy, saying the company's global deep-water exploration momentum remains strong, with multiple new finds emerging over the past few years.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • LLEN

    L&L Energy (LLEN +4.4%) trades up after announcing that its wholly owned coal subsidiary,...

    L&L Energy (LLEN +4.4%) trades up after announcing that its wholly owned coal subsidiary, DaXing-L&L Coal, has entered into a joint sales agreement with China Chengtong Metal's subsidiary, China Chengtong Metal Tianjin. Under the terms of the agreement, both companies will source and market 1M tons of both coking and thermal coal in 2012, generating about $150M in revenues.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM

  • Merkozy, Italian austerity and possibly hopes of ECB backstopping help EU shares close up across...

    Merkozy, Italian austerity and possibly hopes of ECB backstopping help EU shares close up across the board. Euro STOXX 50 +1.15%, London +0.3%, Paris +1.1%, Frankfurt +0.4%, Milan +2.9%, Madrid +1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • WLTW

    Willis Group (WSH +3.4%) gains on an upgrade to Buy from Citigroup, citing key takeaways from...

    Willis Group (WSH +3.4%) gains on an upgrade to Buy from Citigroup, citing key takeaways from its meeting with the company's chaiman and CEO. Citi says management has streamlined operations and created a more aggressive pricing structure that has improved free cash flow. Additionally, the companys is better positioned for the European recession than it was in 2008.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM

  • Joe Weisenthal reckons the collapse in Italian bond yields is not just due to the country's...

    Joe Weisenthal reckons the collapse in Italian bond yields is not just due to the country's €30B austerity, it's because "the market anticipates that after a fiscal compact is reached, the ECB will step in and backstop the whole thing." If so, and the ECB doesn't step in, it also means that what goes down could also go right back up.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • WRLS

    Telular (WRLS +7%) jumps after agreeing to acquire mobile resource management provider SkyBitz...

    Telular (WRLS +7%) jumps after agreeing to acquire mobile resource management provider SkyBitz for $42M in cash and stock. The purchase will make it the world's largest asset-tracking and mobile resource management company.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • REGN

    Regeneron (REGN -5.1%) shares are weighed by data from phase 3 studies of its Eylea treatment...

    Regeneron (REGN -5.1%) shares are weighed by data from phase 3 studies of its Eylea treatment for a major cause of blindness in the elderly that failed to show improvement over Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY) Lucentis in the second year. "Bears will say this takes some competitive advantage away from Eylea," Baird says. "If you're a marketing person at Roche, you're cheering this data."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • EMKR

    Solar panel manufacturer EMCORE (EMKR +4.2%) moves higher after being selected by ATK (ATK...

    Solar panel manufacturer EMCORE (EMKR +4.2%) moves higher after being selected by ATK (ATK +1.5%) for a manufacturing contract, using its ZTJ solar cells in ATK's Ultraflex solar arrays. The solar panels will then be used to power cargo delivery spacecraft for Orbital Sciences' (ORB +2.5%) commercial resupply services missions to the International Space Station.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • UHS

    Credit Suisse calls Friday's selloff in hospital and medical-device companies amid concerns...

    Credit Suisse calls Friday's selloff in hospital and medical-device companies amid concerns about prepayment audits overdone, and recommends buying the entire space on weakness: Universal Health (UHS +5.1%), Tenet Healthcare (THC +10.8%), St. Jude Medical (STJ +4.2%), Health Management Associates (HMA +7.1%), Community Health (CYH +4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • IBM

    It's a good day to own cloud software stocks, as SAP/SuccessFactors helps stoke a frenzy of...

    It's a good day to own cloud software stocks, as SAP/SuccessFactors helps stoke a frenzy of buying (I, II, III). A few more names surging on the news: KNXA +13.7%. OTCPK:SABA +13.9% CSOD +9.5%. CTCT +5.3%. ARBA +11.4%. OTC:TNGO +5.1%. Some traditional business software firms previously linked to takeover chatter are also up strongly:  TIBX +6.2%. CTXS +5.4%. INFA +4.5%. MSTR +6.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • EBAY

    eBay (EBAY +4.2%) spikes higher after Raymond James raises its rating to Strong Buy with a $39...

    eBay (EBAY +4.2%) spikes higher after Raymond James raises its rating to Strong Buy with a $39 price target, based on expected “solid” results this quarter in the core MarketPlace unit and PayPal. RJ likes the stock valuation, with shares trading at 8x 2012 EV/EBITDA and 13x estimated 2012 non-GAAP EPS, with profits growing at 14.5% compounded in 2010-13.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAL

    U.S. Airways (LCC +5.4%) reports strong customer demand and fewer seats available in November, a...

    U.S. Airways (LCC +5.4%) reports strong customer demand and fewer seats available in November, a positive harbinger for the airline industry. Y/Y, passenger revenue per available seat mile jumped 13%, 83.8% of seats were filled, and overall capacity slipped 0.8%. Industry-wide, fares are up sharply Y/Y and the trend likely to continue as capacity cuts increase, led by AMR.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • AGO

    Assured Guaranty (AGO +10.5%) soars after BTIG starts coverage on the credit protection provider...

    Assured Guaranty (AGO +10.5%) soars after BTIG starts coverage on the credit protection provider with a Buy and $35 PT. While noting Assured's exposure to sensitive areas such as muni bonds, residential MBS, and the PIIGS, the firm thinks "the market underestimates its ability to manage these risks. BTIG also notes shares currently trade at just 0.23x their adjusted book value. (last week)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • HCA

    HCA Holdings (HCA +5.8%) gains after being upgraded to Strong Buy at Raymond James on valuation,...

    HCA Holdings (HCA +5.8%) gains after being upgraded to Strong Buy at Raymond James on valuation, saying the Medicaid audit concerns are overdone.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • NBR

    Nabors (NBR +5.9%) is upgraded to Outperform at BMO Capital with a target price raised to $29...

    Nabors (NBR +5.9%) is upgraded to Outperform at BMO Capital with a target price raised to $29 from $24, as the oil service firm is called "one of the best value/corporate makeover stories in the group [whose] turnaround is about to accelerate." In a risk-on day, energy stocks (XLE +2.2%) are higher across the board. Nymex crude +1.2% to $102.19.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • SPPI

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI +6%) trades up after submitting an investigation new drug...

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI +6%) trades up after submitting an investigation new drug application to the FDA for SPI-014, a lanthanum-based nanoparticle phosphate binding agent that can potentially treat hyperphosphatemia in patients with end-stage renal disease. The company plans to start Phase I studies as soon as possible after the FDA review.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • LOJN

    Shares of LoJack (LOJN +9.1%) soar after the firm reactivates a stock purchase plan in order to...

    Shares of LoJack (LOJN +9.1%) soar after the firm reactivates a stock purchase plan in order to support its lagging stock price.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • TIVO

    TiVO (TIVO +3%) rallies after UBS' Brian Fitzgerald starts coverage with a Buy and $13 PT....

    TiVO (TIVO +3%) rallies after UBS' Brian Fitzgerald starts coverage with a Buy and $13 PT. Fitzgerald is pleased with the 117K subscriber gain attached to TiVo's Q3 report - its first gain in four years - and expects additional gains as new deals are signed with video providers. Long-term, Fitzgerald sees trends in online video consumption and content distribution working to TiVo's benefit.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • RAMP

    Acxiom (ACXM +3.9%) moves up after agreeing to sell Acxiom Information Security Systems, its...

    Acxiom (ACXM +3.9%) moves up after agreeing to sell Acxiom Information Security Systems, its background screenings unit, for $74M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • IMAX

    IMAX gains 7.9% following an upgrade to Buy from Stifel. The firm expects IMAX to use its Q4...

    IMAX gains 7.9% following an upgrade to Buy from Stifel. The firm expects IMAX to use its Q4 report to increase its 2012 screen installation guidance and "establish a strong outlook." It also thinks worries about IMAX's flat backlog growth in recent quarters are overblown. IMAX has had a rough 2011 featuring multiple earnings misses (I, II), but shares have rallied strongly from their October lows.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM

  • Acadia Healthcare (ACHC -7.7%) trades down after announcing an 8.3M share secondary offering....

    Acadia Healthcare (ACHC -7.7%) trades down after announcing an 8.3M share secondary offering. Jefferies and Citigroup will serve as joint book-running managers.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • INCY

    Incyte (INCY -2.8%) trades lower after Citi cuts the shares the shares to Neutral from Buy. Citi...

    Incyte (INCY -2.8%) trades lower after Citi cuts the shares the shares to Neutral from Buy. Citi cites limited market potential for Jakafi after conducting a survey that showed only 35% of physicians were expected to prescribe the drug to their patients.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM

  • Italian 10-year bond yields are now -71 bps to below 6%, with markets apparently buying into the...

    Italian 10-year bond yields are now -71 bps to below 6%, with markets apparently buying into the government's austerity package and believing that Merkozy can save the eurozone. It's a remarkable fall from 7.365% less than two weeks ago. Spanish yields are -58 bps at 5.1%. Meanwhile, stocks are higher across both sides of pond.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 2 Comments
  • KOS

    Kosmos Energy (KOS -2%) dips after Deutsche initiates the shares with a lackluster Hold rating,...

    Kosmos Energy (KOS -2%) dips after Deutsche initiates the shares with a lackluster Hold rating, saying that despite the momentum in deep-water exploration, the driller faces "diminishing materiality of exploration" and an increasingly overweighted dependency on crude.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • DOLE

    Dole Foods (DOLE +6.4%) pops after catching an upgrade from Wells Fargo to Outperform from...

    Dole Foods (DOLE +6.4%) pops after catching an upgrade from Wells Fargo to Outperform from Market Perform with an improved price target of $11-$12. Analysts with the firm say shares are already pricing in a "difficult" banana market in Europe and call the downside risk "limited" following Dole's recent slide.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly (SFLY -2.7%) shares are down again, as a Barron's weekend story that selling could...

    Shutterfly (SFLY -2.7%) shares are down again, as a Barron's weekend story that selling could continue becomes a self-fulfilling prophecy. Competitive fears have hurt Shutterfly's shares and the selloff could continue, especially now that Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is in the online photo business, Chris Williams writes. SFLY insiders have sold ~$12M of stock in the past six months.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • SPLS

    Staples (SPLS +2.4%) trades higher after a positive mention in Barron's over the weekend. A low...

    Staples (SPLS +2.4%) trades higher after a positive mention in Barron's over the weekend. A low valuation and the firm's outperformance in relation to peers makes it a "great time" to load up on shares even in a widely beat-up sector, notes Sandra Ward. "Despite the head winds, Staples' management has executed well and continues to produce profit and margin gains, albeit at a slower rate and below expectations."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • CNQR

    Shares of Concur Technologies (CNQR +12.1%) rocket higher, following other (I, II) cloud names...

    Shares of Concur Technologies (CNQR +12.1%) rocket higher, following other (I, II) cloud names getting a push from SAP's play for SuccessFactors (SFSF +51.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • BAC

    Financial stocks (XLF +2.5%) lead today's early advance, with Bank of America (BAC +4.2%),...

    Financial stocks (XLF +2.5%) lead today's early advance, with Bank of America (BAC +4.2%), Citigroup (C +6.4%) and JPMorgan Chase (JPM +5.1%) leading the effort. In contrast, defensive-oriented consumer staples lag the broader market, as the likes of Procter & Gamble (PG +0.2%) and Kraft (KFT +0.1%) display only limited strength.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • ADSK

    Autodesk (ADSK -0.3%) is underperforming after Goldman's Heather Bellini downgrades the firm to...

    Autodesk (ADSK -0.3%) is underperforming after Goldman's Heather Bellini downgrades the firm to Sell, and sets a $32 PT. Bellini thinks investor hopes for 10%+ FY13 revenue growth could prove optimistic, given weak macro conditions and promotion cutbacks, and is also worried about Autodesk's EMEA exposure (40% of sales). (last week)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • UAL

    Analysts at Ticonderoga upgrade shares of United Continental (UAL +3.3%) to Buy from Neutral...

    Analysts at Ticonderoga upgrade shares of United Continental (UAL +3.3%) to Buy from Neutral after factoring in the effect of AMR's bankruptcy on the carrier's future.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • IL

    IntraLinks (NYSE:IL) +5% premarket after Discovery Group reports a 5.8% stake in the provider of...

    IntraLinks (NYSE:IL) +5% premarket after Discovery Group reports a 5.8% stake in the provider of cloud software for managing documents, according to an SEC filing.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM

  • Market preview: Italian bond yields are down, EU shares are up and S&P futures are surging,...

    Market preview: Italian bond yields are down, EU shares are up and S&P futures are surging, +1.4%, meaning the world-saving eurzone debt plan is back on again. Never mind that Italy's €30B austerity package will entrench it in recession. SuccessFactors +51% following news of its sale to SAP; Entergy +6.3% on spinoff plans. Later: factory orders, ISM non-manufacturing, Fedspeak.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • SFSF

    Premarket gainers: SFSF +51%. OTC:AFFY +27%. TLEO +16%. FRO +15%. AGO +13%. LYG +13%. ING +7%....

    Premarket gainers: SFSF +51%. OTC:AFFY +27%. TLEO +16%. FRO +15%. AGO +13%. LYG +13%. ING +7%. STD +5%. IL +5%. RDN +4%. RIG +4%. IRE +4%. CMVT +4%. MT +4%. CPST +3%. BAC +4%. BCS +4%. JEF +4%. CS +4%. CLF +4%. MS +3%. RTK +3%. RF +3%. AKS +3%. C +3%. SD +3%. X +3%. CRM +3%. S +3%. AMR +3%. VE +3%. JPM +3%. PHG +3%. MGM +3%. SINA +3%.
    Losers: REGN -8%. FSIN -6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • TLEO

    Taleo (NASDAQ:TLEO) +15.7% premarket after BMO Capital Markets upgrades shares and raises its...

    Taleo (NASDAQ:TLEO) +15.7% premarket after BMO Capital Markets upgrades shares and raises its target price to $40, following SAP's bid for Taleo rival SuccessFactors (NYSE:SFSF). Investors will view Taleo as "the most obvious acquisition candidate and that Oracle is the most obvious buyer," but BMO also likes its low relative valuation and 20%-30% billings growth rate, on par with SFSF.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • YUM

    Shares of Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) trade 1% higher premarket after the firm raises its 2011 EPS...

    Shares of Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) trade 1% higher premarket after the firm raises its 2011 EPS growth forecast to $2.85/share and says it sees FY12 EPS falling in double-digits. The fast food restaurant operator plans to continue its global push in 2012 by adding about 1.5K new international units, including 600 in China, 800 at YRI, and 100 units in India.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY) +29.5% premarket after the FDA releases a favorable review of the company's...

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY) +29.5% premarket after the FDA releases a favorable review of the company's application for its peginesatide drug, which treats anemia in patients with chronic kidney disease: "A favorable benefit-risk profile supports the approval of peginesatide... The availability of peginesatide would provide an important therapeutic option for dialysis patients in the U.S."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM
  • MET

    MetLife (NYSE:MET) is now up 3% premarket after providing Q4 and 2012 guidance. CC comments from...

    MetLife (NYSE:MET) is now up 3% premarket after providing Q4 and 2012 guidance. CC comments from CEO Steve Kandrian about MetLife conducting a "strategic review," the details of which will be outlined in Q2, could be giving shares a lift.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM
  • GSVC

    GSV Capital (GSVC +7%) rips higher premarket after Barron's recycles a story that the company is...

    GSV Capital (GSVC +7%) rips higher premarket after Barron's recycles a story that the company is about as pure a play as the retail punter can get on IPO candidates Zynga, Facebook, and Twitter.
